com.percussion.content
Interface IPSMimeContent

All Superinterfaces:
com.percussion.content.IPSMimeContentDescriptor
public interface IPSMimeContent
extends com.percussion.content.IPSMimeContentDescriptor

A self-describing content. This interface extends IPSMimeContentDescriptor, which means it has all of the MIME typing, but with the added semantics of representing open (or openable) resources.

Method Summary
 InputStream getContent()
          Returns the byte stream for this content.
 long getContentLength()
          Returns the approximate length of this content in bytes, or -1 if not known.
 String getName()
          Returns the name of this content, or null if the content has no name.
 
Methods inherited from interface com.percussion.content.IPSMimeContentDescriptor
getCharEncoding, getMimeType, getTransferEncoding
 

Method Detail

getContent

InputStream getContent()
                       throws IllegalStateException
Returns the byte stream for this content. Transfers responsibility for closing/cleaning up the stream to the caller. It is up to the particular implementation to decide whether it is valid to call this method more than once (getting more than one input stream), and implementations should document accordingly.

Any transfer decoding that needs to be done should be done TO the bytes returned from this stream. This method must never return null. If the object is not properly initialized, it must throw an IllegalStateException.

Returns:
InputStream
Throws:
IllegalStateException

getContentLength

long getContentLength()
Returns the approximate length of this content in bytes, or -1 if not known.

Note that this return value is merely a hint for performance optimization reasons, and it is not an error to read more bytes from the stream than this length, if the bytes are available.

Returns:
long The approximate content length if known, or -1 if not known.

getName

String getName()
Returns the name of this content, or null if the content has no name.

Note that the interpretation of the name depends on the context in which this content was created. It may be a file name, or it may simply be an unstructured descriptive name (such as "My Blob").

Returns:
The name of the content. May be null.
